Package fast3d.math

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Camera
    each shader needs information about the camera-setting to shade from, to project all the vertices correctly to the screen
    a camera has a position and an orientation (look-direction and up-direction) and a mode-setting
    CameraMode
    defining how a shader should render things on a cameras screen
    MatrixCalculation
    Calculation Class for static usage
    a matrix is a 2dim- double-array with mostly/preferred a same length of first and second dimension
    a matrixes height is the length of the first dimension, it's width the second dimensions length
    the second dimensions length has to be the same for all of the first dimensions entries
    Shader
    to shade means to calculate the screen-position and color of a 3d-point at a specified camera-setting
    a shader is a converter from 3d to 2d
    Vector2d
    a vector2d is a set of 2 double-coordinates, named x and y
    the vectors dimension determines it's count of coordinates
    a vector can be interpreted as a location or direction in it's 2d universe (Cartesian coordinate system)
    Vector3d
    a vector3d is a set of 3 double-coordinates, named x, y and z
    the vectors dimension determines it's count of coordinates
    a vector can be interpreted as a location or direction in it's 3d universe
    Vector4d
    a vector4d is a set of 4 double-coordinates, named x, y, z and a
    the vectors dimension determines it's count of coordinates
    a vector can be interpreted as a location or direction in it's 4d universe
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Viewmode
    defines what type of calculation a shader should do to achieve the desired view of the camera
    users of the viewmode should consider null as PERSPECTIVE
